Description: Terracotta figure of a horse's left haunch. Handmade and hollow. Multiple fingerprints are visible on the interior. Gray-brown clay with a medium texture and indeterminate temper. The figure is broken at the connection of the haunch to the body and just below the tibia and femur joint.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Spurlock Museum, University of Illinois. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallel in Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA508), dated slightly later (late 6th to early 5th century BC). Late 6th century BC parallel from Corinth in the British Museum (Higgins 1954, no.900).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.007) (Phase 3)
